channel.title: Simple Script

item.title: Simple Script
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

You do not need the procedure infront of each of the procedures.
They are procedures, however you only refer to them by their procedure name.
Also, in the parenthesis the arguments are seperated by a comma.
Left: Boolean means that it wants a boolean argument (True|False) for whether or not to left click.

program New; begin ActivateClient; ClickMouse(964, 437, True); // Will left click at 964, 437 on the selected client Wait(5000); ClickMouse(962, 665, True); Wait(5000); ClickMouse(441, 628, True); Wait(5000); ClickMouse(706, 602, True); end.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple Script
item.dc:creator: @Adelmas Adelmas
item.description:
@Adelmas wrote:

Ok I am just testing if I know enough to make SCAR click for me in certain places.

I get an error when I use this:

IM NEW SO NO FLAMMING

program New; begin Procedure ActivateClient; procedure ClickMouse(964, 437: Left: Boolean); Procedure Wait(5000); procedure ClickMouse(962, 665: Left: Boolean); Procedure Wait(5000); procedure ClickMouse(441, 628: Left: Boolean); Procedure Wait(5000); procedure ClickMouse(706, 602: Left: Boolean); end.

Read full topic
